alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Franklin; Gulf; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 19 at 9:22PM EDT until March 22 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Apalachicola River near Blountstown affecting Liberty, Calhoun, Gulf and Franklin Counties. For the Apalachicola River...including Blountstown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Apalachicola River near Blountstown. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding will occur at Douglas Landing and Willis Landing Campgrounds in Gulf County. The 19.0 ft level at Blountstown may at times not be representative of river levels in these areas due to tidal effects, winds, or local rainfall and should be used with caution. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CDT Saturday /8:15 PM EDT Saturday/ the stage was 17.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM CDT Saturday /8:15 PM EDT Saturday/ was 17.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.5 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.6 feet on 01/27/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
